alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 7:13AM EDT until July 25 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR ALLEGHENY AND SOUTHEASTERN BEAVER COUNTIES... At 713 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Shaler Township, Plum, North Side Pittsburgh, Baldwin, Hampton Township, Scott Township, Wilkinsburg, Robinson Township, Munhall, Brentwood and Swissvale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
